dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.resource.res.log.trans.Pipe
dataStructure.description:
The Pipe object class is a class of managed objects which ensures the transfer of information between two TerminationPoints. This is derived from the m.3100 specification. The Pipe object class is not instantiable because the transfer is effected via the client-server relationship of trail and connection. Connectivity direction is determined by the directionality of the a and z termination points. If an instance of this class is bidirectional, the a- and z-termination points shall also be bidirectional. If an instance of this class is unidirectional, the a-point shall be the source TP and the z-termination point shall be the sink TP. This object is taken from M.3100. DEN-ng integrates it into the ManagedTransmissionEntity hierarchy so that it can interact with IETF managed objects.

This entity is abstract

This entity is optional
dataStructure.label: Pipe

child.name: isUniDirectional
child.description:
This is a Boolean attribute that, if TRUE, defines this Pipe to be UniDirectional. If FALSE, it is by definition BiDirectional.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: isUniDirectional

child.name: operatingLayerRate
child.description:
This is a string attribute that defines the current operating layer rate of this Trail or Connection.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: operatingLayerRate

child.name: logicalDevice
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity *

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association LogicalDeviceGovernsPipes

This association end is optional
child.label: logicalDevice

child.name: subNetwork
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity 0..1

This association end has aggregation composite

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association PipesInSubNetwork

This association end is optional
child.label: subNetwork

child.name: terminationPoint
child.description:
This element is generated from an association end.

This association end has multiplicity *

This association end has aggregation none

This association end is navigable

This association end is an end of association TPsInPipe

This association end is optional
child.label: terminationPoint
